description: Narcissa Niblack Thorne designed this miniature interior “entirely in the spirit of Marie Antoinette—dainty in coloring and full of her symbols of design.” The queen was fond of roses, which were often incorporated into the molded decorations of swags, garlands, and baskets. The garden tools and musical instruments in the carvings of the panel heads represent her love of nature and music.
artist_info:
Designed by Narcissa Niblack Thorne
American
1882-1966
title: E-24: French Salon of the Louis XVI Period, c. 1780
